intro: Lachemilla rivulorum, commonly known as the stream lichen, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered in a fine, woolly texture. Lachemilla rivulorum thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found near streams or in forest understories.
